Data Structures

struct  RTC_TIME
struct  RTC_DATE

Defines

PC I/O register address used to comunicate with the RTC

#define RTC_ADDR_REG   0x70
 I/O address that contains the RTC address to communicate with.
#define RTC_DATA_REG   0x71
 I/O address that contains the data read from or written to the RTC.
Bit Meaning in STAT-A register

#define RTC_UIP   (1 << 7)
 1-update in progress, 0-data valid for next 244 usec
#define RTC_DV2   (1 << 6)
 Divider.
#define RTC_DV1   (1 << 5)
 Divider.
#define RTC_DV0   (1 << 4)
 Divider.
#define RTC_RS3   (1 << 3)
 Rate selector.
#define RTC_RS2   (1 << 2)
 Rate selector.
#define RTC_RS1   (1 << 1)
 Rate selector.
#define RTC_RS0   (1 << 0)
 Rate selector.
Bit Meaning in STAT-B register

#define RTC_SET   (1 << 7)
 1-Stop updating, 0-update normally
#define RTC_PIE   (1 << 6)
 1-Periodic interrupt enable
#define RTC_AIE   (1 << 5)
 1-Alarm interrupt enable
#define RTC_UIE   (1 << 4)
 1-Update-ended interrupt enable
#define RTC_SQWE   (1 << 3)
 1-Square Wave Enable
#define RTC_DM   (1 << 2)
 Data Mode, 1-Binary, 0-BCD.
#define RTC_12_24   (1 << 1)
 1-24 hours, 0-12 hours
#define RTC_DSE   (1 << 0)
 1-Day-light saving
Bit Meaning in STAT-C register

#define RTC_IRQF   (1 << 7)
 1-An interrupt occurred, if PF=PIE=1 || AF=AIE=1 || UF=UIE=1
#define RTC_PF   (1 << 6)
 1-Periodic interrupt occurred
#define RTC_AF   (1 << 5)
 1-Alarm interrupt occurred
#define RTC_UF   (1 << 4)
 1-Update interrupt occurred
Bit Meaning in STAT-D register

#define RTC_VRT   (1 << 7)
 1-Valid RAM and time

Enumerations

The RTC registers

enum  rtc_regs {
  SEC, SEC_ALARM, MIN, MIN_ALARM,
  HOUR, HOUR_ALARM, WEEK_DAY, MONTH_DAY,
  MONTH, YEAR, RTC_STAT_A, RTC_STAT_B,
  RTC_STAT_C, RTC_STAT_D
}

#define RTC_12_24   (1 << 1)

1-24 hours, 0-12 hours

Byte read_rtc ( Byte  add  ) 

Returns rtc data from I/O address add. Doesn't check valid bit

Byte read_rtcv ( Byte  add  ) 

Returns rtc data from I/O address add. Check valid bit

void rtc_intc ( void   ) 

Guarda o estado antigo do Stat a.

void rtc_read_alarm ( RTC_TIME *  alarmtime  ) 

Read RTC stored alarm

Uses read_rtcv() and bcd2dec()

void rtc_read_date ( RTC_DATE *  adate  ) 

Read RTC stored date

Uses read_rtcv() and bcd2dec()

void rtc_read_time ( RTC_TIME *  atime  ) 

Read RTC stored time

Uses read_rtcv() and bcd2dec()

void rtc_valid (  ) 

Wait until data in rtc is valid. Data is valid until +/- 240 usec after this function returns, thus a read/write can be done to the RTC within this time period

void rtc_write_alarm ( RTC_TIME *  alarmtime  ) 

Write alarm to RTC

Uses write_rtcv() and dec2bcd()
